website_summaries.verdict: WWE 2k15 is a hard game to recommend to someone who isn't a wrestling fan and it's not without its issues, but if you know the difference between an Enziguri and a Senton there's a lot of fun to be had.
pros: WWE 2K15 looks great on next-gen console hardware, and it's all too easy to lose a lot of time to the new career mode
cons: Features from previous WWE games were lost in the name of graphical upgrades, and even die-hard fans will be tested by the learning curve and constant loading screens

customer_reviews.title: Ok, But Much Better Wrestling Games Out There
customer_reviews.text: My boys are wrestling fanatics. We have purchased many and for many years. Some have been fantastic and others awful. The previous version of this game was really good so I had high expectations for the 2015 version. Unfortunately it did not meet the same standards. The younger kids really enjoyed it as they really don't know what they are doing and just like playing a video game. The older kids; however, were a bit disappointed with the play in this games. They did love the graphics as they were outstanding but besides that this game was just a medicore game. If you can get it cheap then I would buy it but I wouldn't pay full price.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Ceballos

customer_reviews.title: We Didn't Know How Good We Had It
customer_reviews.text: Hard to believe all these years later, with the junkiest wrestling game every made in 2K20 and next year's title canceled, that I can look back on this title so fondly. It's still rough around the edges and didn't give a ton of innovation from previous years, but heck at least it worked!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Paden

customer_reviews.title: disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: This game feels very trimmed down compared to the last generation. The gameplay is kind of clunky. At the beginning of the match you do some sort of rock paper scissors type game when you grapple that i really wish you could turn off. You can't create Divas, and there are no generic intro music, moves or anything. You have to use some other superstars motions and intro moves/music. I'm pretty disappointed with this game honestly. but its the only wrestling game on the current gen system.
customer_reviews.author: Espi

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for under 20 bucks.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best wrestling games I've ever played. The combat mechanics are largely timing based and revolve around parrying your opponent and then countering with a slam ECT. They also include a lot of classic footage from old wwf events. All in all the game was made with care and pretty much any wrestling fan needs to have it.
customer_reviews.author: kiz

customer_reviews.title: Let's get ready to rumbbllleeee!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Although not all characters are available. Unless you unlock. Bought to play with my fiance. Career mode kinda sucks. Me and fiance both tried and failed...must be us though lol
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Its ok...
customer_reviews.text: Got the ps4 version just for the new My career mode. It started off pretty interesting but then went downhill when the game just drifted from an actual story to nothing. Other than that though the game is pretty much the same as last years release if you like the past games you will like this if you dont you wont. Nothing much new ( a few new moves and roster update) and they took out alot of the CAW items (which seems to be the trend every year).
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: A WWE game worth playing
customer_reviews.text: This game is great! Though the characters are limited as well as the different game modes. Otherwise the graphics of the characters are great and the game hasn't had any technical issues from what I've experienced...and also the sound track is nice, even though there are like 10-12 songs. Highly recommended game, and I don't even watch the show, I just like to play the game with friends!
customer_reviews.author: Dominik H.

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.
customer_reviews.text: This games graphics are the only thing any good, hate the move sets, the controls, collision detection is poor. I don't know why I keep falling for this year after year. And don't get me started on the DLC, this gouging has got to stop. Even the season pass is gouging the customer with not all content available.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Nozeika

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Game
customer_reviews.text: Not a good game, graphics are sloppy and controls aren't great. The voice acting isn't even slightly matched up with characters mouth movements.

customer_reviews.title: All in all I'm glad my son loves it and wasnt
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my son. He has been begging for it for months. We got it yesterday and I swear he never turns it off. He absolutely loves it. I have played with him a few times and I can see why he likes it. In my opinion though the moves you makebdont happen as you press the buttons. It could be my inexperience though. All in all I'm glad my son loves it and wasnt disappointed

customer_reviews.title: it's great but it's the same

I will admire that the graphics are very impressive and stunning, but still could use some work. I was expecting the game to be fast, but sadly it is still like the other previous installments since the ps3/xbox 360 era. 2k did a good job, but still some things needed work. Could've been another Smackdown vs raw 2004 but oh well let's keep it pg.

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but still way watered down.
customer_reviews.text: I'll admit it's fun, but it's incredibly glitch, and they removed way more features than it added. If you want to customize your CAW's entrance, you get a handful of things to choose from. Remember create a finisher? Gone. Custom music? Gone, and now customizing your CAW's appearance is more challenging now, as there are way less options than in previous games. The only improvement I noticed are the graphics, but some wrestlers still look really weird (just look at The Rock)

customer_reviews.title: DeJa Vu.
customer_reviews.text: The game may have a new stamina system, But it is the exact same game as last year. You start out every match with the minigame and then you are thrown right back into the same crap that you have played for the past five years. MyCareer mode was the main reason I bought this game but the mode is over as soon as you win the WWE Championship. WWE universe mode is the same as it was last year. I was hoping that 2K would make some improvements but instead they have just slapped their label on the same game you played over and over again.

customer_reviews.title: decent, but could have been a lot better
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this game, considering that I came straight from WWE '13. It was an okay game, but it is missing a lot of things. The customization has been dumbed down for this generation (PS4, X-Box One) and has left me wanting more. There are also a lot of missing match types and that really disappoints me. But the biggest drawback to this is probably the lack of a decently sized roster. And then there's the Mycareer, but if you really want to know about that, watch the YouTube reviews.

product_meta.title: WWE 2K15 - PlayStation 4
product_meta.description: The next generation of WWE video games has arrived. WWE 2K15 will usher in a new era of WWE video games and deliver the gaming experience that fans have sought for generations.
feature_bullets: All-New MyCAREER Mode: For the first time ever, take your custom Superstar through an unprecedented and authentic WWE career spanning countless hours of gameplay. From NXT to RAW, make your way up to the WWE Championship and live the life of a real WWE Superstar. Xbox One and PlayStation 4 only.

Presentation Overhaul: Proprietary facial and body scanning technology deliver the most realistic WWE Superstars, Divas and Legends EVER. Xbox One and PlayStation 4 Only. Listen to Jerry Lawler and Michael Cole call the action with the best commentary featured in a WWE game to date, with more than five times the lines recorded than any other year.  WWE 2K15 will also feature a custom soundtrack featuring today's hottest artists, curated by John Cena.

Introducing: 2K Showcase: Relive the groundbreaking rivalries of John Cena vs. CM Punk and Triple H vs. Shawn Michaels in a new single player campaign told through your gameplay and historic WWE footage.

Gameplay Enhancements: WWE 2K15 will significantly improve the core gameplay experience through key additions and improvements designed to elevate the franchise now and into the future.  By using new motion capture technology, 2K15 includes five times more new animations than any WWE game before.  Combined with a brand-new chain wrestling system, WWE 2K15 will take the drama and adrenaline of a WWE match to new heights…just like on WWE TV; Xbox One and PlayStation 4 only

WWE Universe and Creation Suite:  Create your own Custom Superstar, or customize WWE Superstars and Divas, Move-Sets and entrances. Take control of WWE as your actions shape your Universe: storylines, schedule, rivalries, alliances and more

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars502 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
